bullets.text: US job openings flat in October; hires, separations little changed, signaling steady but cooler labor demand.
Fed widely expected to cut rates and update forward guidance at upcoming decision.
Survey: Hassett seen as likely next Fed chair, though most respondents prefer different nominee.
Trump greenlights Nvidia AI chip sales to China, reversing long-standing tech curbs; GOP pushback underscores strategic rift.
Nvidia allowed to sell H200 to China, but demand uncertainty clouds outlook amid U.S.-China tensions.
Wall Street shaking off AI bubble fears, as earnings and demand still support lofty valuations for now.
Commercial real estate deal volume falls for first time in nearly two years, reflecting higher-rate drag on transactions.
CVS boosts 2025 guidance, sending shares higher as healthcare giant signals stronger-than-expected results.
Oracle’s AI buildout leaves investors wary of rising debt ahead of earnings.
Eli Lilly investing $6B in Alabama plant to produce obesity pill and other drugs, expanding U.S. manufacturing.
SpaceX reportedly targets 2026 IPO at $1.5T valuation, signaling potential mega-listing in private space sector.
Canada to fast-track immigration for U.S. H-1B holders, intensifying North American talent competition.
Instacart’s AI pricing tools may raise grocery costs, study finds, spotlighting inflationary risks of algorithmic pricing.
New gravitational lens measurements sharpen Hubble-tension debate, deepening mystery over universe’s expansion rate.
